title: How to Make Paper Doll Food

steps.headline: Cut a square of orange paper and roll it into a cone.
Stuff a small amount of green paper into the cone to make the bush on top.
Crumple a piece of brown paper into a ball.
Make an indent in it with a pencil and set it aside.
Take a piece of white paper and roll it into a cone before taping it like the previous orange one.
Fill in the indent with glue, then put the white cone into the glue.
Leave it to dry.
Take a strip of colored paper and tape the ends together.
Cut out a circle slightly larger than the rim of the cake.
Glue the circle onto the rim.
Cut out a strip of brown paper and draw squiggly lines.
Crinkle it up slightly to make it look crispy.
Cut a circle out of cardboard for the bread.
Cut a smaller circle out of red construction paper for the sauce.
Cut small squares out of red and white papers and arrange them on the sauce.
Cut out as many small circles as you want from thin cardboard.
Draw chocolate chips with a dark brown felt.
Cut out a blob of white paper, and a smaller circle of yellow paper for the yolk.
Glue the yellow circle on top of the blob.
Cut out 2 brown circles for the bread.
Cut out patine with dark brown paper.
Cut out the other things of the burger; e.g., lettuce, cheese, mayonnaise, etc.
Glue them together.
Finished.
Use roasted-chicken colored paper.
steps.description: Brown and golden yellow are the best colors. If you don't have colored paper, you can always paint some paper before it's done.

steps.headline: Draw a roasted chicken shape on the paper, or just do a wing or a drumstick.
steps.description: Use an image to guide your shaping.

steps.headline: Paint if needed.
steps.description: Follow the packaging instructions for when to paint.

steps.headline: Place the finished chicken on a tint plate to serve.
steps.description: A plate can be made from a bottle lid, cardboard circle, or use a miniature doll's plate.

text: Carrots Cut a square of orange paper and roll it into a cone. Tape the cone. Stuff a small amount of green paper into the cone to make the bush on top.  Drumsticks Crumple a piece of brown paper into a ball.  Make an indent in it with a pencil and set it aside.  Take a piece of white paper and roll it into a cone before taping it like the previous orange one.  Fill in the indent with glue, then put the white cone into the glue.  Leave it to dry.  Hollow cakes Take a strip of colored paper and tape the ends together.  Cut out a circle slightly larger than the rim of the cake.  Glue the circle onto the rim.  Bacon Cut out a strip of brown paper and draw squiggly lines.  Crinkle it up slightly to make it look crispy.  Pizza Cut a circle out of cardboard for the bread.  Cut a smaller circle out of red construction paper for the sauce. Glue it to the cardboard. Cut small squares out of red and white papers and arrange them on the sauce. Glue them on. Cookies Cut out as many small circles as you want from thin cardboard. (The kind used as cereal boxes.) Draw chocolate chips with a dark brown felt.  Sunny-side up eggs Cut out a blob of white paper, and a smaller circle of yellow paper for the yolk.  Glue the yellow circle on top of the blob.  Burgers Cut out 2 brown circles for the bread.  Cut out patine with dark brown paper.  Cut out the other things of the burger; e.g., lettuce, cheese, mayonnaise, etc.  Glue them together.  Finished.  Chicken Use roasted-chicken colored paper. Brown and golden yellow are the best colors. If you don't have colored paper, you can always paint some paper before it's done. Draw a roasted chicken shape on the paper, or just do a wing or a drumstick. Use an image to guide your shaping. Paint if needed. Follow the packaging instructions for when to paint. Place the finished chicken on a tint plate to serve. A plate can be made from a bottle lid, cardboard circle, or use a miniature doll's plate.
sentences: Carrots Cut a square of orange paper and roll it into a cone.
Tape the cone.
Stuff a small amount of green paper into the cone to make the bush on top.
Drumsticks Crumple a piece of brown paper into a ball.
Make an indent in it with a pencil and set it aside.
Take a piece of white paper and roll it into a cone before taping it like the previous orange one.
Fill in the indent with glue, then put the white cone into the glue.
Leave it to dry.
Hollow cakes Take a strip of colored paper and tape the ends together.
Cut out a circle slightly larger than the rim of the cake.
Glue the circle onto the rim.
Bacon Cut out a strip of brown paper and draw squiggly lines.
Crinkle it up slightly to make it look crispy.
Pizza Cut a circle out of cardboard for the bread.
Cut a smaller circle out of red construction paper for the sauce.
Glue it to the cardboard.
Cut small squares out of red and white papers and arrange them on the sauce.
Glue them on.
Cookies Cut out as many small circles as you want from thin cardboard.
(The kind used as cereal boxes.)
Draw chocolate chips with a dark brown felt.
Sunny-side up eggs Cut out a blob of white paper, and a smaller circle of yellow paper for the yolk.
Glue the yellow circle on top of the blob.
Burgers Cut out 2 brown circles for the bread.
Cut out patine with dark brown paper.
Cut out the other things of the burger; e.g., lettuce, cheese, mayonnaise, etc.
Glue them together.
Finished.
Chicken Use roasted-chicken colored paper.
Brown and golden yellow are the best colors.
If you don't have colored paper, you can always paint some paper before it's done.
Draw a roasted chicken shape on the paper, or just do a wing or a drumstick.
Use an image to guide your shaping.
Paint if needed.
Follow the packaging instructions for when to paint.
Place the finished chicken on a tint plate to serve.
A plate can be made from a bottle lid, cardboard circle, or use a miniature doll's plate.
